result.execSummary:
The defendant Eugene Caldwell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).
  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: count two, but consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for five days.
AS TO COUNTS ONE AND TWO: to run concurrent as to each count.

miscConds.notes: $294.00 to be paid first, either to the victim Aileen H., Speedway or Amazon credit card.  Court ordered the agent to determine who will be in receipt of restitution.
To be paid secondly:  Pay costs, surcharges, assessment, supervision fees during the period of probation.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment with tax intercept.

No new law violations reaching the level of probable cause finding.
No asscociation with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses or drug dealings.
No  contact with Aileen H. or the Speedways located at  305 N. 35 Street, in the City of Milwaukee, Milwaukee County, Wisconsin; and 9130 W. Oklahoma Avenue in the City of West Allis, Milwaukee, WI.

Cooperate with agent.
Take all prescribed medications ordered by the physician.  Defendant is involved with the Methadone Program.
Participate in a cognitive thinking program and any other programming deemed appropriate by the department and/or agent.

AODA assessment.  Follow up care and treatment.  Defendant is under the supervision of the Methadone Program.  Curt ordered for that to continue.  Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*Conditions apply to both counts/case.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: -Received, filed and signed by the Court on February 1, 2017; Copies distributed to parties.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and 
forwarded to  Judge Dee
for review. os

Received from the Department of Corrections - Probation, request to:
[    ]   Extend Probation
[    ]   Set Restitution
[    ]   Remove Court Obligations
[  x ]   Review / Modify Probation
[    ]   Convert Unpaid Obligations to Civil Judgment

Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:    Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS, STRIAGHT TIME, in the House of Correction to run consecutive as to any other sentence, but to run concurrent as to each count; with credit for 5 days time served.  

Court IMPOSED AND STAYED the sentence and placed Defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 YEARS to run concurrent as to each count. 

COURT ORDERED THE FOLLOWING CONDITIONS AS TO PROBATION:
*  No new law violations reaching the level of a probable case finding.
*  Cooperate with agent.
* 2nd, Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision fees during the period of probation. Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  AODA assessment and follow up care and treatment. Defendant is under the supervision of the Methadone Program. Court ordered for that to continue.
*  Random urine screens with no positive results.  No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealings.
*  Take all prescribed medications ordered by the physician.  Defendant is involved with the Methadone Program.
*  1st, Restitution in the amount of $294.90 either the victim, Aileen H. / Speedway / or  Amazon credit card.  Court ordered the agent to determine who will be in receipt of restitution.
*  No contact with the victim Aileen H. or  the Speedways located at 305 N. 35th Street, in the City of Milwaukee, Milwaukee County, Wisconsin; and 9130 W. Oklahoma Avenue, in the City of West Allis, Milwaukee County, Wisconsin.
*  Participate in a Cognitive Thinking Program, and any other programming deemed appropriate by the Department and or agent.

Received and filed with court:
*  Amended Information
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2 (MISDEMEANORS):    Defendant waived rights and pled GUILTY.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.
Received and filed.

Defendant Eugene Caldwell in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  On motion of the State Court AMENDED Count 1 from Missapropriate ID Info - Obtain Money  (Felony)  TO 2 Counts of Theft By Fraud (Value Not Exceeding $2,500) under Wisconsin Stats. 943.20(1)(d) and (3)(a), 939.51(3)(a)  Class A Misdemeanors.    Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Parties are prepared to proceed with Projected Guilty Pleas.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point

Defendant Eugene Caldwell in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Jeremy Arn for Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant just had oral surgery and is currently on pain medication.  Adjournment requested.  Court addresses Justice Point Report.  Court admonishes defendant.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed with court.

Defendant Eugene Caldwell in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations. 
Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.
Defendant in compliance with Justice Point supervision at this time.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report, received and filed.
Received and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: Aileen H.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.

Defendant Eugene Caldwell in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Eugene Caldwell in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
